title: Welcome to BSTA 511/611!
text:
Welcome to BSTA 511/611!

Estimation and Hypothesis Testing


Applied Biostatistics I

Fall 2024








Instructor
 Dr. Meike Niederhausen
 Vanport 660E
 niederha@ohsu.edu


Course details
 Mondays, Wednesdays
 Sept 30 - Dec 11
 1:00 PM - 2:50 PM
 In-person


Office Hours
 Wednesdays 2:50-3:50 pm
 In classroom
 Fridays 3:30-4:30 pm
  Webex (link on Sakai)




Contacting me
E-mail or Slack is the best way to get in contact with me. I will try to respond to all course-related e-mails within 24 hours Monday-Friday.








 View the source on GitHub

title: About
text:
Assistant Professor of Biostatistics in the OHSU-PSU School of Public Health
Faculty Biostatistician for OHSU’s Biostatistics & Design Program
Affiliate Investigator for the HSR&D Center to Improve Veteran Involvement in Care (CIVIC) at the Portland VA

title: Schedule
text:
Week
Dates
Topics
Chapter sections




1
W 9/27
Day 1: Introduction to R & RStudio



2
M 10/2
Day 2: Intro to Data, Data collection, Summarizing numerical data
1.1-1.4



W 10/4
Day 3: Data visualization, exploratory data analysis (EDA), and summarizing categorical data
1.5-1.7 & supplementary


3
M 10/9
Day 4: Probability
2.1-2.2.4



W 10/11
Day 5: Bayes’ Theorem
2.2.5


4
M 10/16
Day 6: Random variables, Binomial distribution
3.1-3.2



W 10/18
Day 7: Normal and Poisson distributions
3.3-3.4


5
M 10/23
Day 8: Variability in estimates
4.1



W 10/25
Exam 1: Days 1-6
Ch 1, 2, 3.1-3.2


6
M 10/30
Day 9: Confidence Intervals
4.2



W 11/1
Day 10: Hypothesis Testing: Single-sample with t-distribution & Two-sample paired data
4.3, 5.1, 5.2


7
M 11/6
Day 11: Hypothesis Testing: Two-sample independent data; Power
5.3-5.4; Supplementary material



W 11/8
Day 12: Inference for a single proportion or difference in proportions
8.1-8.2


8
M 11/13
Day 13: Chi-squared tests, Fishers exact test
8.3-8.4



W 11/15
Exam 2: Days 7-11
Ch 3.3-3.4, 4, 5.1-5.4; Supplementary material


9
M 11/20
Day 14: Comparing Means with ANOVA.
5.5, Supplementary material



W 11/22
Day 15: Simple Linear Regression
6.1-6.2


10
M 11/27
Day 16: Simple Linear Regression
6.3-6.4



W 11/29
Day 17: Non-parametric tests (sign, signed-rank, rank-sum, Kruskal-Wallis)
Supplementary material


11
M 12/4
Review - catch up




W 12/6
Exam 3: Days 12-17
Ch 8, 5.5, 6, non-parametric

title: About
text:
Assistant Professor of Biostatistics in the OHSU-PSU School of Public Health
Faculty Biostatistician for OHSU’s Biostatistics & Design Program
Affiliate Investigator for the HSR&D Center to Improve Veteran Involvement in Care (CIVIC) at the Portland VA

title: About
text:
Course info
This webpage was created for BSTA 511/611 in the OHSU-PSU School of Public Health. BSTA 511 is taken primarily by students in the Biostatistics MS/MPH and Epidemiology MPH programs. BSTA 611 is taken by PhD students in various programs across OHSU.

title: About
text:
Acknowledgements

Thank you to Nicky Wakim for creating her amazing webpage for BSTA 550, and sharing her code on GitHub. Having her template made creating this website a much smoother process.
Thank you also to Andrew Bray for presenting the From R Markdown to Quarto ASA Travelling Workshop to the Oregon Chapter of the ASA in June 2023. This workshop was a great starting point in making the switch from RMarkdown to Quarto and also create Quarto webpages.
